name: Asana
title: Asana

children.text: The Asana modules enable you to monitor and manage tasks, projects, teams, users, workspaces, stories, or attachments in your account.
In order to use Asana with Make, it is necessary to have an Asana account. If you do not have one, you can create an Asana account at
To connect your Asana account to Make, follow the general instructions for

data.label: Connect an application
data.overridedLabel: Connecting to services

children.text: button, Make will redirect you to the Asana website.
If you are already logged into Asana, the connection will be automatically established. If not, log into your Asana account.
If everything went right, you can now continue creating your
Checks whether new tasks or subtasks have been made.
This module is available only for users with a subscription plan.
If Asana is unable to deliver a webhook for 24 hours, the webhook will be deactivated.

data.label: Asana
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Asana account.

children.text: Select the task type you want to watch. For example,
Select the resource you want to watch. For example,
Select the workspace whose tasks you want to watch and select the relevant options for the autopopulated fields.
Set the maximum number of tasks Make will return during one execution cycle.
Retrieves task details when a new task is created.

format to only return tasks that are either incomplete or that have been completed since this time.
format to only return tasks that have been modified since the given time.

Watch New Subtasks in a Task

children.text: Select whether you want to map the Task ID or select the task manually using drop-down menus.
Select or map the ID of the task you want to retrieve details about.
Create a Task or a Subtask
Creates a task or a subtask.

data.label: Asana
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Asana account.

children.text: Select the corresponding object where you want to create a task.
Enter the workspace where you want to create a task.
Select the projects you want to create a task for.
Select sections of the project you want to create a task for.
Creates a new subtask and adds it to the parent task.
Enter values to custom fields if needed.

Custom fields can only be added to a task when the task is added to a project, or as a subtask to a task. If you just add it to a workspace, it is not possible to add custom fields. No project -> no custom fields. Also, if you add it under a parent task, then it automatically belongs to the project of that parent task.
Enter the name of the new task.
Enter more detailed, free-form textual information associated with the task.
This field will be overwritten if the
Enter notes of the text with formatting as HTML.
Select the user or map the user ID of the user you want to assign the task to.
Select whether to specify just a due date or a due date and time combination.
Enter the date (or date and time, depending on your selection in the
field above) on which this task is due.
Enter the date (or date and time, depending on your selection in the
field above) on which the task starts. The due date must be set in order to set the
Select the subtype of this resource.
represents a single moment in time. This means tasks with this subtype cannot have a
Approvals are only available for users in an Enterprise or Business plan.
Enable this option if the task is liked by you.
Enable this option to mark the task as completed.
Allows you to add app-specific metadata.
The external gid. Max size is 1024 characters. Can be a URI.
Enter the data of the BLOB (binary large object).
Select the users you want to add as followers of the task.

When no followers are submitted, the task assignee and the task creator are added as followers by default. When submitting followers, the creator and task assignee are not added by default. This also means that the creator can't see the task afterward unless specifically added.
Select tags you want to assign to the task.

data.label: Asana
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Asana account.

children.text: Select whether you want to map the Task ID or select the task manually using drop-down menus.
Select or map the ID of the task you want to update.
Select the workspace to display custom fields from.
Enter values to custom fields if needed.

When mapping, we can only generate the workspace custom fields for the user. You have to select the correct custom fields (i.e. not submit any custom fields that are not used by the task; a task only has access to custom fields when it belongs to projects using those custom fields).
The displayed custom fields might be disabled; you should not try to use any disabled custom fields.
It's impossible to filter out the disabled fields on Make's side as we can't retrieve the enabled field.

Enter the date on which this project is due in the
Enter the date on which the project starts in the YYYY-MM-DD format. The due date (above) must be set to set the field,
Enable setting the project as a template. This is not possible for archived projects, personal projects, or user task lists.
option if the project is public to the organization. If you select
, do not share this project with other users in this organization without explicitly checking to see if they have access.

Color: Select the color associated with the status update.
Text: Enter the text content of the status update.
Enable this option if the project is archived. Archived projects do not show in the UI by default and may be treated differently for queries.
Select the default view (list, board, calendar, or timeline) of a project.
Enter the date on which this project is due in the
Enter the date on which the project starts in the YYYY-MM-DD format. The due date (above) must be set in order to set the
Enable to set the project as a template. This is not possible for archived projects, personal projects, or user task lists.
option if the project is public to the organization. If you select
, do not share this project with other users in this organization without explicitly checking to see if they have access.

children.text: Enter or select the project you want to duplicate.
Enter the name of the new project.
Select the workspace that contains the team you want to assign to the new project.
Select or map the team for the new project. If the team is not defined, the new project will be in the same team as the original project.
Select the elements that will be duplicated in the new project. Tasks are always included.
Enable auto-shifted dates should skip weekends.

Enter the first start date in the YYYY-MM-DD format in the duplicated project to the given date. The rest of the start dates will be offset by the same amount as the start dates in the original project.
Enter the last due date in the YYYY-MM-DD format in the duplicated project to the given date. The rest of the due dates will be offset by the same amount as the due dates in the original project.
Returns the number of tasks in the specified project.

data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Asana account.

children.text: Select or enter (map) the ID of the custom field you want to edit.
Enter the name of the custom field.
Enter the description of the custom field.
Select the number of places. Only relevant for custom fields of type
. This field dictates the number of places after the decimal to round to, i.e., 0 is the integer value, 1 round to the nearest tenth, and so on. It must be between 0 and 6, inclusive.
Select the format of the custom field.

data.label: Asana
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Asana account.

children.text: Select whether you want to map the Custom Field ID or manually select the custom field using drop-down menus.
Enter (map) or select the ID of the custom field you want to delete.
Add an Option to a Custom Field
Creates an enum option and adds it to this custom fields list of enum options.
A custom field can have at most 50 enum options (including disabled options).

data.label: Asana
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Asana account.

children.text: Enter a custom field option ID
Select whether you want to map the Custom Field Option ID or manually select the custom field option using drop-down menus.
Enter (map) or select the ID of the custom field option you want to insert the enum option to.
Select an existing enum option within this custom field before the new enum option is inserted. It cannot be provided together with Insert After.
Select an existing enum option within this custom field, after which the new enum option should be inserted. It cannot be provided together with Insert Before.
Enter the name of the enum option.
Select the color of the enum option.
Updates an existing enum option. The name, description, and number precision/format (will be ignored if the type is not a number) can be updated.
The user who locked the field can only update those custom fields.

data.label: Asana
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Asana account.

children.text: Enter a custom field option ID
Select whether you want to map the Custom Field Option ID or manually select the custom field option using drop-down menus.
Enter (map) or select the ID of the Enumeration Option you want to update.
Enter the name of the enum option.
Select the color of the enum option.
Select whether or not the enum option is a selectable value for the custom field.
Retrieves custom field settings (that contain custom fields) of the project.

data.label: Asana
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Asana account.

children.text: Select or map the project you want to retrieve custom field settings for.
Set the maximum number of custom field settings Make will return during one execution cycle.
Adds or removes custom fields in a project.

data.label: Asana
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Asana account.

children.text: Select whether you want to add or remove the custom field.
Select whether you want to map the Custom Field ID or select the custom field manually using drop-down menus.
Select or map the custom field ID you want to add or remove.
The ID of the Custom Field Setting before which the new Custom Field Setting will be added.
It cannot be provided together with Insert After
The ID of the Custom Field Setting, after which the new Custom Field Setting will be added.
It cannot be provided together with Insert Before.
Select whether this field should be considered important to this container (for instance, to display in the list view of items in the container).

data.label: Asana
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Asana account.

children.text: Select the corresponding object you want to specify the goal by.
Select or map the Workspace ID whose goals you want to list.
Select or map the project whose goals you want to list.
Select or map the Team ID whose goals you want to list.
Select the user whose portfolios you want to retrieve.
Select the portfolio whose goals you want to list. Note that portfolios are only available for Enterprise or Business plan users.
Select the time periods to list the goals within.
Set the maximum number of goals Make will return during one execution cycle. The default value is 10.

data.label: Asana
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Asana account.

children.text: Select the corresponding object you want to specify the goal by.

to make a partial entry update.

customCSS:
<style>
@media print {
  html, body {
    overflow-x: visible;
  }
}
#tally-widget-button {
  position: fixed !important;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  display: none;
  visibility: visible !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
  color: #0C121D;
  border: 2px solid #0C121D;
  border-radius: 4px;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-family: 'Inter';
  text-align: center;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  cursor: pointer;
  z-index: 999999 !important;
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  outline: none;
  touch-action: manipulation;
  pointer-events: auto;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}
.button-text {
  display: inline-block;
  margin-right: 8px;
}
.button-text::before {
  content: attr(data-text);
}
#tally-widget-popup {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  display: none;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  z-index: 999999;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 0px solid #0C121D;
  padding-top: 30px;
}
#tally-widget-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 10px;
  background: none;
  border: none;
  font-size: 36px;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
  color: #0C121D;
}

  .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
    font-family: 'Inter' !important;
  }

  .dark .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #F6F6F6 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column > div > div > div.flex.flex-1.w-full.justify-center.pb-0 > div > div.flex.items-center.pl-0.pr-2.mb-5.xl\:-mt-1\.5 > div > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > div.flex.pr-2.text-gray-500.items-center {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  a.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-public-space-links-wrap .ab-public-space-link:first-of-type {
    border-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-toc-item-active a{
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 {
    text-decoration-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-left:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .ab-nav-left-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-right:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .ab-nav-right-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
#tally-inline-popup {
  position: fixed;
  display: none;
  z-index: 999999;
  width: min(420px, 90vw);
  height: min(550px, 80vh);
  background: #fff;
  color: #0c121d;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.08);
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.22), 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.12);
  overflow: hidden;
  padding: 5px;
}

#tally-inline-popup iframe {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  border: 0;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

#tally-inline-popup .tip-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  right: 8px;
  width: 32px;
  height: 32px;
  line-height: 28px;
  font-size: 22px;
  text-align: center;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.85);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
  border-radius: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

#main-column a[data-form-url],
#main-column a[data-tally-url] {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
  text-decoration: underline;
  text-underline-offset: 2px;
  text-decoration-thickness: 1.5px;
  font-weight: 600;
}

@media (max-width: 640px) {
  #tally-inline-popup {
    width: min(360px, 94vw);
    height: min(500px, 80vh);
  }
}

#main-column .ab-cta-button a.ab-cta-button {
  background-color: #7302D5;
}

/* Titles in purple */
.ab-link-blocks-wrapper .ab-link-block-item.ab-docs-card-mode .ab-link-block-content-wrap .font-bold {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
}

.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
}

</style>

reusableContentVariables.name: string
reusableContentVariables.description: a list or sequence of characters (like letters, numbers, and symbols) used to represent text in a computer programming.

reusableContentVariables.name: Operations
reusableContentVariables.description: An operation is a single module run to process data or check for new data.

reusableContentVariables.name: Credits
reusableContentVariables.description: Credits (formerly operations) are the currency for running scenarios.

reusableContentVariables.name: Route
reusableContentVariables.description: A route is a path that data can flow through in a scenario, visualized as the dotted lines between modules.
